title: You Just Never KNOW-VEMBER!
body_text:
WALL v. ALL NINE Results
Totally Unpredictable!
Flash Results by Game
WALL: 1, 3, 4, 5, 6
ALL: 2, 7
Despite the overwhelming numbers, Team ALL fell way short in their quest to conquer the mighty "Knights". WALL's multi-time headliners were just too much for the unwelcomed visitors to handle.
WALL 5, ALL 2.
"Another hard fought match between WALL and ALL. However, like usual, 'the best' prevailed."
- R. LETSCHE
The YEARBOOK
Although they couldn't get the job done, Team ALL NINE* did have had its share of talent: Manasquan
(A. Kelly, J. Kelly, Krott, Londono, Yochum)
; Ocean Township
(Edwards, Teitelbaum, Vetrano)
; M.A.S.T.
(Biesiada);
Allentown
(DiBuccio)
; Monmouth Regional
(Tronolone)
*Conspicuous by his absence, one Kevin Jay Megill Jr. missed his first Wall-All battle.
And it only took WALL a mere seven warriors: Kevin Fitzpatrick, Melissa Kerr, Zach Katz, Ryan Letsche, Michelle Mullins, Kevin Adams, Justin Wolf.
"Even though this is still the first game [removed from victory], we'll beat 'em the third time around."
- M. "SPUTZ" KROTT
The Rules
: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match
: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 5 - 2, with WALL picking up its 6th victory of the nine total contests.
Moments & Stars
: Michelle Mullins's killer Game 1 performance, single-handledly eliminating her opposition to earn the win; Jon Yochum's unintentional rimshot in Game 7
Attendance
: 18, comprised of 13 men and 5 women.
Familiar Faces
: Former 2006 Captains Champion Joe Kelly was on-hand for DODGEBALL 163.
Other Notes
: Despite disgusting weather throughout the day, not a drop of rain was felt from those in attendance.
"ALL got slaughtered!"
- J. WOLF
You Just Never KNOW-VEMBER!
The bright tennis lights shut-off at a rare 9pm, forcing the competition to move to the front courts .. in the dark! This was only the second time in
ECD's
three-plus year history where both the Front and Back courts saw action
(see
DODGEBALL 105
)
.
The
Letsche Rims
were also null and void due to the mysterious "Writer's" rather late arrival. Garbage cans compensated for the wooden targets on both Front and Back courts.
EastCoastDodgeball's backstage crew very much appreciates the effort put forth by all in attendance due to, as already mentioned, "The Writer's" unfortunate inability to arrive at the normal 7:15 start.
________________________________________
___________
Up Next ... DODGEBALL 164 and Mid-Season Main Event!
body_html:
WALL v. ALL NINE Results
Totally Unpredictable!

Flash Results by Game
WALL: 1, 3, 4, 5, 6
ALL: 2, 7

Despite the overwhelming numbers, Team ALL fell way short in their quest to conquer the mighty "Knights". WALL's multi-time headliners were just too much for the unwelcomed visitors to handle. WALL 5, ALL 2.

"Another hard fought match between WALL and ALL. However, like usual, 'the best' prevailed."
- R. LETSCHE

The YEARBOOK
Although they couldn't get the job done, Team ALL NINE* did have had its share of talent: Manasquan (A. Kelly, J. Kelly, Krott, Londono, Yochum); Ocean Township (Edwards, Teitelbaum, Vetrano); M.A.S.T. (Biesiada); Allentown (DiBuccio); Monmouth Regional (Tronolone)
*Conspicuous by his absence, one Kevin Jay Megill Jr. missed his first Wall-All battle.

And it only took WALL a mere seven warriors: Kevin Fitzpatrick, Melissa Kerr, Zach Katz, Ryan Letsche, Michelle Mullins, Kevin Adams, Justin Wolf.

"Even though this is still the first game [removed from victory], we'll beat 'em the third time around."
- M. "SPUTZ" KROTT

The Rules: Classic two-team match-up.
The Match: Team WALL defeated Team ALL, 5 - 2, with WALL picking up its 6th victory of the nine total contests.
Moments & Stars: Michelle Mullins's killer Game 1 performance, single-handledly eliminating her opposition to earn the win; Jon Yochum's unintentional rimshot in Game 7
Attendance: 18, comprised of 13 men and 5 women.
Familiar Faces: Former 2006 Captains Champion Joe Kelly was on-hand for DODGEBALL 163.
Other Notes: Despite disgusting weather throughout the day, not a drop of rain was felt from those in attendance.

"ALL got slaughtered!"
- J. WOLF

You Just Never KNOW-VEMBER!
The bright tennis lights shut-off at a rare 9pm, forcing the competition to move to the front courts .. in the dark! This was only the second time in ECD's three-plus year history where both the Front and Back courts saw action (see DODGEBALL 105).

The Letsche Rims were also null and void due to the mysterious "Writer's" rather late arrival. Garbage cans compensated for the wooden targets on both Front and Back courts.

EastCoastDodgeball's backstage crew very much appreciates the effort put forth by all in attendance due to, as already mentioned, "The Writer's" unfortunate inability to arrive at the normal 7:15 start.
___________________________________________________

Up Next ... DODGEBALL 164 and Mid-Season Main Event!
